author: leobago
content: Hello, unfortunately I have another conf-call that I cannot miss so I would need to skip the call today; but I wanted to report a bit on the tests we ran with snappy

author: leobago
content: We ran the Go version of snappy (github.com/golang/snappy) v0.0.1 on a Intel(R) Core(TM) i5-6600K CPU @ 3.50GHz with Go version 1.14 and tested it on 15 blocks downloaded from the ethereum blockchain. We ran the test 10 times for each block and we always obtained the exact same compressed result for each block, but the compression time changes, so we take the average of the 10 runs. We got an average compression ratio of 1.850, the minimum compression ratio observed was 1.507 and the maximum 2.416. The average compression speed was 508.922 MB/s, and we observed some variation on these numbers, going from 380.042 MB/s for the lowest to 785.055 MB/s for the fastest. We also noticed that in general decoding is almost twice faster than encoding, with the compression taking about 282µs for a ~100KB block, but only 149µs for decoding.

author: leobago
content: More detailed results can be found in the following spreadsheet:

author: leobago
content: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1SoXvmPfm1BRVcdDm7CuwaWDjxp5a3NzGMBLViQjBNqA/edit?usp=sharing

author: leobago
content: we can extend this much more if necessary

author: leobago
content: let me know if there are questions/remarks
